definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Investors who seem to beat the market year after year are just lucky.
sentences.chinese: 投资者能经年累月地击败市场，纯粹是运气使然。

sentences.english: Bilateral talks can be dragged out.
sentences.chinese: 双边会谈恐将经年累月。

sentences.english: More commonly, liver failure develops slowly over the course of years.
sentences.chinese: 在更常见的情况下，肝脏是经年累月慢慢发生衰竭的。

sentences.english: As the old ceiling is ripped out, decades of accumulated dust and dirt falls down .
sentences.chinese: 奋力拆除的天花板，倾泄而下的是经年累月的尘土。

definition: year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
variant of 長年累月|长年累月[chang2 nian2 lei3 yue4]
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
to accumulate over a long period of time
deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
lit. one morning and one evening (idiom)/fig. in a short period of time/overnight
